title: Man beaten unconscious after terrifying street brawl breaks out in London
text:

A man was beaten unconscious in a brutal fight which broke out in a London street.

A video taken by a driver from inside a double-decker bus shows a group of five men brawling in the early hours of July 13 in Katherine Street, Croydon.

The footage begins with the fight between two groups at a pedestrian crossing.

A woman is then seen stepping in to try to calm the situation, shouting "stop" and asking them why they are fighting.

The scuffle moves along the pavement and loud smacks are heard as the group push each other against the bus.

At least one of them is seen to be armed with a baton-like object.

(Image: Facebook)

The driver filming the incident issues a 'code red', alerting police to the fight.

As the bus alarm sounds, the woman continues to try to break up the voilence. Three men are then seen beating and kicking a man to the ground, who later appears unconscious.

The driver tells a person on the other end of the radio: "It's a fight over here where I am, send the police ASAP.

(Image: Facebook)

"One guy is down they are killing each other, man."

The person asks if they have any weapons and the driver replies: "There's some sticks, I don't know exactly. I don't know just call the police ASAP."

The driver is then heard shouting that police are on the way.

(Image: Facebook)

A Metropolitan Police spokesperson said: "Police were called at approximately 3.30am on Saturday, July 13 to reports of two men assaulted in Katharine Street, Croydon.

"Officers and London Ambulance Service attended and both men, aged in their 40s, were taken to hospital for treatment to their injuries – neither man’s condition was life threatening.

"The investigation was closed after the victim decided not to pursue any further action."
description: The incident was filmed by a terrified bus driver in Croydon who called police as the melee turned in a violent fight
